docs.lead_paragraph: By brutally stripping food aid from its farm bill, the House ended a tradition of decency.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes House for stripping food stamp program from its version of farm bill, saying it ends decades-old compromise in which food assistance has been tied to crop subsidies for Big Agriculture; calls on Senate-House conference committee to threaten to block subsidies unless funding for food stamps is restored.
docs.snippet: By brutally stripping food aid from its farm bill, the House ended a tradition of decency.

docs.abstract: Now is the time to feature apricots in both your desserts and main dishes, writes Martha Rose Shulman in this week’s Recipes for Health.
docs.snippet: Now is the time to feature apricots in both your desserts and main dishes, writes Martha Rose Shulman in this week’s Recipes for Health.

headline.main: Blaming the Patient, Then Asking Forgiveness

docs.abstract: In a TED talk that has struck a chord with many, Dr. Peter Attia admitted to something he believes many doctors may be guilty of. The compassion for overweight patients often may not be as deep as it is for those who are sick for other reasons.
docs.snippet: In a TED talk that has struck a chord with many, Dr. Peter Attia admitted to something he believes many doctors may be guilty of. The compassion for overweight patients often may not be as deep as it is for those who are sick for other reasons.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans resist compromising their extreme positions and retreat further and further from the national mainstream.

headline.main: In the House, a Refusal to Govern
headline.print_headline: In the House, a Refusal to Govern

docs.abstract: Editorial argues the intransigence by House Republicans on immigration reform and farm bill demonstrate how little concern they have for country's prosperity and future of their own party; holds their refusal to negotiate is ultimately a refusal to govern.
docs.snippet: Republicans resist compromising their extreme positions and retreat further and further from the national mainstream.

docs.lead_paragraph: On a party-line vote, the House forced through a stalled farm bill, despite Democratic objections that stripping the food stamp program would leave poor Americans without a safety net.

headline.main: House Republicans Push Through Farm Bill, Without Food Stamps
headline.print_headline: House Republicans Push Through Farm Bill, Without Food Stamps

docs.abstract: Republicans muscle a pared-back agriculture bill through House with 216-to-208 vote, stripping out food stamp program to satisfy recalcitrant conservatives but losing what little Democratic support bill had when it failed in June; it is first time food stamps have not been part of farm bill since 1973.
docs.snippet: On a party-line vote, the House forced through a stalled farm bill, despite Democratic objections that stripping the food stamp program would leave poor Americans without a safety net.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and RON NIXON

docs.lead_paragraph: Simple, rustic tarts show off peak-season fruit.
docs.snippet: Simple, rustic tarts show off peak-season fruit.

docs.lead_paragraph: CANNATA--Mary Grace, 87, of New York City passed away on July 9, 2013 in Mount Vernon, NY after a long battle with cancer. She went to high school at Theodore Roosevelt High School in the Bronx and Hunter College in NYC. She earned a MS in nutrition from New York University. Mary is preceded in death by her parents, Salvatore and Carmela, and two brothers Anthony and Arthur. Mary is survived by her sister Linda (Patrick) D'Ambrosio of Cortland Manor; two children Gregory (Wende) of Mount Vernon and Arleen (Ian) Seed of Silver Spring, MD; two grandchildren Alison (John) Hendele of Dobbs Ferry and Robert Cannata of New York City; two step- grandchildren Alistair (Charlene) Seed and David (Mary) Seed and one great-grandchild Mabel Seed. Visiting July 11, 2-4pm and 7-9pm Edwards Dowdle Funeral Home, Dobbs Ferry, NY. Funeral service July 12, 10am Edwards Dowdle Funeral Home, with burial to follow at Mount Hope Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, memorial donations may be made to the Ovarian Cancer Research Fund.
